job_tasks.phrase: Apply your Python experience on the job, while building exciting AI-powered tools.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core activity of using existing programming skills (Python) to build tools that incorporate AI, fitting the definition of integrating AI into software.

job_tasks.phrase: Work on a mission-critical SaaS platform used by international customers for inventory, reservation, and ticketing.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the context of working on a software platform, a core software engineering activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with a team of passionate developers who are happy to share their knowledge and help you grow.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights collaboration within a development team, a key aspect of software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Experiment with innovative technologies and shape the future of Generative AI in real-world applications.
job_tasks.justification: While 'experiment' can lean towards specialization, the context of shaping 'real-world applications' points to integration and development of AI features into existing software.

job_tasks.phrase: Developing Generative AI-powered tools that enhance internal processes and uncover new possibilities for S3 Passenger.
job_tasks.justification: This directly states the development of tools powered by Generative AI, fitting the integration aspect.

job_tasks.phrase: For example: improving our intelligent AI powered chat bot so users are able to find answers quickly based on our internal documentation.
job_tasks.justification: This provides a concrete example of enhancing an existing tool (chatbot) with AI capabilities, which is software integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Designing and implementing backend microservices in the AWS Cloud using AWS Bedrock with Anthropic Claude models to support high-performance and scalable systems.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the design and implementation of backend services, a core software engineering task, within a cloud environment.

job_tasks.phrase: Learning Python while applying it to meaningful, real-world projects.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on learning and applying a programming language in a project context.

job_tasks.phrase: For example: using AI chat bots instead of complex wizards in our S3 Passenger product for configuration.
job_tasks.justification: This is an example of integrating AI (chatbots) into a product to replace existing functionality, which is software integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborating to design secure, high-quality, and maintainable software.
job_tasks.justification: This describes collaborative software design with a focus on quality and maintainability.

job_tasks.phrase: Debugging and optimising systems using tools like New Relic, Sentry, and other monitoring platforms.
job_tasks.justification: Debugging and optimizing systems using monitoring tools falls under the operational aspects of software and systems management.

job_tasks.phrase: Work with OpenTofu, Kubernetes, and AWS Cloud Development Kit to build Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) solutions.
job_tasks.justification: Building infrastructure using IaC tools is a core part of modern software development and operations.

job_tasks.phrase: improving our intelligent AI powered chat bot so users are able to find answers quickly based on our internal documentation.
job_tasks.justification: While the primary task is improving a chatbot, the mention of finding answers based on 'internal documentation' strongly suggests the use of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) principles to inform the chatbot's responses.
This phrase implies the need to access and utilize internal documentation, which is a form of data management and preparation for AI models.

job_tasks.phrase: using AI chat bots instead of complex wizards in our S3 Passenger product for configuration.
job_tasks.justification: This implies that the AI chatbot will need to understand and process configuration data, which relates to data handling.

profile.rationale: The job ad heavily emphasizes software development tasks (1.A.1) such as building AI-powered tools, designing backend microservices, and working with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Kubernetes, IaC). It also explicitly mentions Generative AI specific tasks like improving an AI chatbot and using AWS Bedrock with Anthropic Claude models, which falls under GenAI Specialization (1.B.2 and 1.B.3). The role requires a balanced mix of both software engineering and GenAI specialization, with a clear focus on integrating GenAI into a SaaS platform, fitting the 'Core GenAI Engineer' profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and detailed, explicitly mentioning both core software engineering responsibilities and specific Generative AI technologies and tasks. The responsibilities align well with the defined profiles, making the classification straightforward.
